name: Quantierra
headline: Sourcing investment real estate
description:
Quantierra sources real estate investments for developers.

It uses their database and algorithms to determine what can be built, its value, and the probability of it selling. Taking a 1.5% cut of any property they help sell, They’ve made $141,000 in revenue in 3 months, and say they have $310,000 in signed term sheets.
generated_description:
Quantierra is an innovative startup focused on sourcing investment real estate, primarily for developers. It utilizes a smart combination of a robust database and sophisticated algorithms to evaluate properties—determining what can be built, estimating their value, and assessing the likelihood of a successful sale. 

The business model is straightforward: Quantierra earns a 1.5% commission on any property transactions they facilitate. This model is proving effective, as the company has generated $141,000 in revenue in just three months and has secured $310,000 in signed term sheets—a clear indication of traction in their market.

Founded in the Y Combinator Batch W15, Quantierra calls New York City home and operates with a lean team of five. While details on their full team and partnerships are a bit sparse (notably, there's a mention of an unspecified group partner), their taglines—'real-estate', 'investing', 'new-york'—capture their essence well.

If you’re interested in learning more, you can visit their website at [quantierra.com](http://quantierra.com). With a promising start and the backing of a reputable accelerator, Quantierra is poised to make waves in the real estate investment sector.
